Dietary factors (such as a high-fat diet or a diet lacking in fruits and vegetables) High levels of stress or anxiety. Exposure to environmental toxins or pollutants. These are just a few examples of how various lifestyle and environmental factors can increase an individual’s risk of experiencing cardiovascular diseases such.
